# â­ï¸Overview

This file is used to import the Link2Care arrest data and do some initial data cleaning. 

**NOTE on data sources:**

The arrest data is securely transmitted by Dr. Gonzalez as an Excel file, which is stored on OneDrive in Participant Data > Arrest Data Requests.


# ğŸ“¦Load packages

```{r message=FALSE}
library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
library(readxl, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
library(readr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
```


# ğŸ“¥Import data 

* Had to remove password from Excel sheet before import. File -> Passwords... -> Delete password.   

```{r}
path <- "data/arrest_data/current_arrest_data.xlsx"
```

Check the most recent file modification dates on OneDrive and print for user when this file is being sourced.

```{r}
cat(
  stringr::str_extract(path, "([^/]+$)"),
  "last modified on UTHealth server:",
  as.character(file.info(path)$mtime), "\n"
)
```

```{r}
arrest <- read_excel( 
  path,
  sheet = "Sheet1",
  col_names = c(
    "subject", "arrested", "arrested_date_baseline", paste("arrested_date",1:12, sep = "_"),  paste("arrested_num_summary",sep = "_")
  ),
  col_types = c(
    "numeric", "text", "date", "date", "date", "date", "date", "date", "date", "date", "date", "date", "date", "date", "date", "numeric"
  ),
  na = c("", "None"),
  skip = 1
) %>%
filter(!is.na(subject))

# 2023-01-25: Arrest data has new summary measure "arrestednum_summary," to identify total number of arrests per participant.

# Print a message for when this file is being sourced

cat(
  paste(Sys.Date(), ":"),
  "Arrest data", nrow(arrest), "rows and", ncol(arrest), "columns.\n"
)

# 2022-07-11: Arrest data 274 rows and 8 columns.
# 2023-03-15: Arrest data 499 rows and 16 columns.

```


# ğŸ’¾Save the data frame

```{r}
path <- "../Participant Data/R Data/arrest.rds"
```

```{r}
write_rds(arrest, path)
```

Print a message for when this file is being sourced

```{r}
cat(
  paste0(Sys.Date(), ":"),
  "Arrest data saved to", path, "\n"
)

# 2021-06-30: Arrest data saved to /Volumes/Link2Care/Participant Data/R Data/arrest.rds

# 2023-01-25: Arrest data with summary measure of total arrests saved to /Volumes/Link2Care/Participant Data/R Data/arrest.rds

# 2023-03-13: Arrest data with summary measure of total arrests saved to /Volumes/Link2Care/Participant Data/R Data/arrest.rds

```


# ğŸ–¨Print a message for when this file is being sourced

```{r}
cat(

rm(list = ls()[ls() != "source_rmd"])
```
